Package gw.cc.policy.entity

Interface Policy

All Superinterfaces:
com.guidewire.cc.domain.claim.ClaimContactRoleOwner, ClaimContactRoleOwner, com.guidewire.cc.domain.contact.EntityContactRoleOwner
public interface Policy extends com.guidewire.cc.domain.claim.ClaimContactRoleOwner
Policy Insurance policy.

    • finder

      static final PolicyFinder finder
      Policy Finder

  • Method Details

    • isCurrencyEditable

      boolean isCurrencyEditable()
      Returns true if the Currency on this Policy is editable, which is generally true if this Policy's Claim does not have any Transactions.
      Returns:
      true if the Currency property should be editable by the user

    • createVehicleRU

      VehicleRU createVehicleRU()
      Returns a PolicyVehicle. The vehicle of the PolicyVehicle is a newly created, editable, but empty vehicle. The PolicyVehicle is initialized with the vehicle, policy and vehicle number
      Returns:
      an empty policyvehicle linked to this policy object

    • removeVehicleRU

      void removeVehicleRU(VehicleRU vru)
      Removes the given PolicyVehicle from the policy and also cleans up the associated vehicle and vehicle coverages.
      Parameters:
      vru - The vehicle risk unit
      Throws:
      com.guidewire.pl.web.controller.UserDisplayableException - if the vehicle is referenced by the claim, any exposure or any exposure coverage - in fact if allowVehicleRemoval(entity.Vehicle) returns false then this method will throw an exception instead of trying to remove the vehicle

    • allowVehicleRemoval

      boolean allowVehicleRemoval(Vehicle v)
      Returns false if the vehicle is referenced by the claim, any exposure or any exposure coverage.
      Parameters:
      v - the Vehicle to test whether it is allowed to be removed
      Returns:
      false if the vehicle is referenced by the claim, any exposure or any exposure coverage, true otherwise

    • isPolicyVehicle

      boolean isPolicyVehicle(Vehicle v)
      Returns true if the given vehicle is referenced by this policy's policy vehicle risk unit array, false otherwise. Returns false if vehicle is null.
      Parameters:
      v - the vehicle to test whether it is referenced by this policy.
      Returns:
      true if the vehicle is referenced by this policy, false otherwise

    • isStatCodingEnabled

      boolean isStatCodingEnabled()
      Returns whether stat coding is enabled? Consults the system configuration parameter EnableStatCoding.
      Returns:
      true if stat coding is enabled, false otherwise

    • getCappedStatCodes

      StatCode[] getCappedStatCodes()
      Gets the list of stat codes returned by
      invalid reference 
      #getStatCodes()
      but sorts it by display name and then caps it if it is longer than getStatCodeListCap(). Typically used to build a select list in the UI where the list should not be too long, and any additional values can be added via a picker.
      Returns:
      an array of stat codes, at most getStatCodeListCap() long. May be empty but is never null

    • isStatCodeListCapped

      boolean isStatCodeListCapped()
      Returns whether the list of stat codes returned by getCappedStatCodes() is capped.
      Returns:
      true if the list is capped, false otherwise

    • getStatCodeListCap

      int getStatCodeListCap()
      Get the cap on the number of stat codes returned by getCappedStatCodes(). This value is read from the system configuration parameter MaxStatCodesInDropdown.
      Returns:
      the cap on the number of stat codes, as specified by the MaxStatCodesInDropdown configuration parameter

    • getStatCode

      StatCode getStatCode(Key statCodeID)
      Finds a stat code by ID from its owning Policy.
      Parameters:
      statCodeID - the ID of the StatCode to find.
      Returns:
      the located StatCode, or NULL if no match was found.

    • createStatCode

      StatCode createStatCode()
      Returns an empty statcode linked to this policy object.
      Returns:
      an empty statcode linked to this policy object

    • removeStatCode

      void removeStatCode(StatCode statCode)
      Removes the given stat code from the policy.
      Parameters:
      statCode - the stat code to remove from this policy

    • addCoverage

      void addCoverage(PolicyCoverage coverage)
      Adds the given coverage to the policy. Also defaults the Coverage's Currency to Policy Currency, if not set.
      Parameters:
      coverage - the coverage to add

    • removeCoverage

      void removeCoverage(PolicyCoverage coverage)
      Removes the given coverage from the policy.
      Parameters:
      coverage - the coverage to remove

    • createEndorsement

      Endorsement createEndorsement()
      Returns an empty Endorsement linked to this policy.
      Returns:
      an empty Endorsement linked to this policy

    • removeEndorsement

      void removeEndorsement(Endorsement endorsement)
      Removes the given endorsement from the policy.
      Parameters:
      endorsement - the endorsement to remove

    • getPolicyPeriods

      PolicyPeriod[] getPolicyPeriods()
      Returns the PolicyPeriods associated with this Policy. Returns an empty array if none exist.
      Returns:
      the policy periods

    • addToPolicyPeriods

      void addToPolicyPeriods(PolicyPeriod policyPeriod)
      Adds this policy to the given PolicyPeriod. If this policy already belongs to the PolicyPeriod, then does nothing.
      Parameters:
      policyPeriod - the PolicyPeriod to add

    • addToRiskUnitsAndAssignRUNumber

      void addToRiskUnitsAndAssignRUNumber(RiskUnit riskUnit)
      Assigns an "RUNumber" to the RiskUnit before calling
      invalid reference 
      PolicyStubI#addToRiskUnits(entity.RiskUnit)
      to add it
      Parameters:
      riskUnit - The risk unit

    • isExceedsLimit

      boolean isExceedsLimit()
      Returns true if any of the aggregate limits for this policy have been exceeded. Returns false if this policy has no policy period or if its policy period has no aggregate limits.
      Returns:
      true if any of the aggregate limits for this policy have been exceeded, false otherwise

    • isExceedsLimit

      boolean isExceedsLimit(AggregateType valueType)
      Returns true if any of the aggregate limits for this policy have been exceeded. Returns false if this policy has no policy period or if its policy period has no aggregate limits. This method can indicate whether it is applied to aggregate limits or aggregate deductibles.
      Parameters:
      valueType - indicates whether this method applies to Aggregate Limits or to Aggregate Deductibles
      Returns:
      true if any of the aggregate limits for this policy have been exceeded, false otherwise

    • isWithinLimit

      boolean isWithinLimit(BigDecimal amount)
      For the aggregate limits on this policy, returns true if any of them are within the given amount of their limit.

      For example, if the limit amount is $100 and the given amount is $20, then this method returns

      • false if the amount used is less than $80
      • true if the amount used is greater than or equal to $80 and less than or equal to $100
      • false if the amount used is greater than $100
      Returns true if this policy has no policy periods or if its policy periods have no aggregate limits.
      Parameters:
      amount - The amount that is subtract from the limit amounts of all applicable aggregate limits. If amount is null, then amount is considered to be 0.
      Returns:
      true if any aggregate limits on this policy is within the the given amount of their limit, false otherwise

    • isWithinLimit

      boolean isWithinLimit(BigDecimal amount, AggregateType valueType)
      For the aggregate limits on this policy, returns true if any of them are within the given amount of their limit. This method can be specified to be applied to aggregate limits or aggregate deductibles.

      For example, if the limit amount is $100 and the given amount is $20, then this method returns

      • false if the amount used is less than $80
      • true if the amount used is greater than or equal to $80 and less than or equal to $100
      • false if the amount used is greater than $100
      Returns true if this policy has no policy periods or if its policy periods have no aggregate limits.
      Parameters:
      amount - The amount that is subtract from the limit amounts of all applicable aggregate limits. If amount is null, then amount is considered to be 0.
      valueType - indicates whether this method applies to Aggregate Limits or to Aggregate Deductibles
      Returns:
      true if any aggregate limits on this policy are within the given amount of their limit, false otherwise

    • isWithinPercentOfLimit

      boolean isWithinPercentOfLimit(BigDecimal percent)
      For the aggregate limits on this policy, return true if any of them are within the given percentage of the limit.

      For example, if the limit amount is $100 and the given percentage is 20%, then this method returns

      • false if the amount used is less than $80
      • true if the amount used is greater than or equal to $80 and less than or equal to $100
      • false if the amount used is greater than $100
      Returns true if this policy has no policy periods or if its policy periods have no aggregate limits.
      Parameters:
      percent - The percent that is applied to the limit amounts of all applicable aggregate limits. If percent is null, then the limit amount is not adjusted.
      Returns:
      true if any aggregate limits on this policy are within the given percentage of the limit, false otherwise

    • isWithinPercentOfLimit

      boolean isWithinPercentOfLimit(BigDecimal percent, AggregateType valueType)
      For the aggregate limits on this policy, return true if any of them are within the given percentage of the limit. This method can be specified to be applied to aggregate limits or aggregate deductibles.

      For example, if the limit amount is $100 and the given percentage is 20%, then this method returns

      • false if the amount used is less than $80
      • true if the amount used is greater than or equal to $80 and less than or equal to $100
      • false if the amount used is greater than $100
      Returns true if this policy has no policy periods or if its policy periods have no aggregate limits.
      Parameters:
      percent - The percent that is applied to the limit amounts of all applicable aggregate limits. If percent is null, then the limit amount is not adjusted.
      valueType - indicates whether this method applies to Aggregate Limits or to Aggregate Deductibles
      Returns:
      true if any aggregate limits on this policy are within the given percentage of the limit, false otherwise

    • createLocationBasedRU

      LocationBasedRU createLocationBasedRU(IEntityType riskUnitType)
      Returns a new LocationBasedRU of the subtype specified by riskUnitType.
      Parameters:
      riskUnitType - the type of LocationBasedRU
      Returns:
      a new LocationBasedRU linked to this policy
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if riskUnitType is not a subtype of LocationBasedRU

    • removeLocationBasedRU

      void removeLocationBasedRU(LocationBasedRU pru)
      Removes the given LocationBasedRU from the policy and also cleans up the PolicyProperty (if no other RiskUnits refer to it) and any property coverages.
      Parameters:
      pru - The risk unit to remove
      Throws:
      com.guidewire.pl.web.controller.UserDisplayableException - if allowPropertyRemoval(entity.PolicyLocation) returns false then this method will throw a user displayable exception and will not delete the property

    • createPolicyLocation

      PolicyLocation createPolicyLocation()
      Returns a new PolicyLocation linked to this policy.
      Returns:
      The new policy location

    • allowPropertyRemoval

      boolean allowPropertyRemoval(PolicyLocation property)
      Returns false if the property is referenced by the claim, any exposure or any exposure coverage. Does not check if the property is referenced by any RiskUnits.
      Parameters:
      property - the property to test whether it is allowed to be removed
      Returns:
      false if the given property is referenced by the claim, any exposure, or any exposure coverage, false otherwise

    • hasRUOnPolicy

      boolean hasRUOnPolicy(PolicyLocation property)
      Returns true if the given property is referenced by this policy's location based risk unit array, false otherwise. Returns false if property is null.
      Parameters:
      property - the property to be tested whether it is this policy's property
      Returns:
      true if the given property is referenced by this policy's policy property array, false otherwise

    • containsCoveredParty

      boolean containsCoveredParty(Contact contact)
      Check whether a contact is covered by this policy.
      Parameters:
      contact - the contact to search the covered parties for
      Returns:
      true iff the contact individual id is the same as one of our covered parties.

    • containsExcludedParty

      boolean containsExcludedParty(Contact contact)
      Check whether a contact is excluded from this policy.
      Parameters:
      contact - the excluded party to search for.
      Returns:
      true iff the Contact already exists in the set of excluded parties.

    • getVehicleRU

      VehicleRU getVehicleRU(Key vehicleId)
      Look through the policy's array of PolicyVehicles for one whose vehicle id matches the given id.
      Parameters:
      vehicleId - the id of the vehicle
      Returns:
      the matching PolicyVehicle, or null

    • getEndorsement

      Endorsement getEndorsement(Key endorsementID)
      Finds an Endorsement by ID from its owning Policy.
      Parameters:
      endorsementID - the ID of the Endorsement to find.
      Returns:
      the located Endorsement, or NULL if no match was found.

    • getAllCoverages

      Coverage[] getAllCoverages()
      Returns all coverages on this policy, i.e., policy-level, vehicle, and property coverages.
      Returns:
      all coverages on this policy

    • getCoveragesByCoverageType

      Coverage[] getCoveragesByCoverageType(CoverageType coverageType)
      Returns subset of all-coverages that are of certain CoverageType. By "all-coverages" we mean: policy-level, vehicle, and property.
      Parameters:
      coverageType - the coverageType to find coverages for
      Returns:
      subset of all-coverages that are of the given coverage type

    • hasWorkersCompData

      boolean hasWorkersCompData()
      Returns true if the policy contains employment class code (Workers' Comp) data.

      The UI uses this to determine whether to display Employment Class Codes in the policy screens.

      Returns:
      true if the policy contains Workers' Comp data.

    • hasVehicleData

      boolean hasVehicleData()
      Returns true if the policy contains Vehicle data (generally associated with an auto policy).
      Returns:
      true if the policy contains Vehicle data.

    • hasPropertyData

      boolean hasPropertyData()
      Returns true if the policy contains Property data (generally associated with homeowners or commercial policies).
      Returns:
      true if the policy contains Property data.

    • isCommercialPolicy

      boolean isCommercialPolicy()
      Returns true iff the policy type contains the commercial policy code.
      Returns:
      true iff the policy type contains the commercial policy code.

    • validate

      ValidationResult validate()
      Attempt to validate the policy. Note that this method has the side-effect of setting the validation level on the policy, and hence requires that the current user have EDIT permissions on the policy or will throw an exception.
      Returns:
      a ValidationResult object containing the results of the validation operation.

    • getPotentialLossTypes

      LossType[] getPotentialLossTypes()
      Returns the loss types that are compatible with this policy.
      Returns:
      The potential loss types for the associated claim
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - If the PolicyType property is not populated

    • getVehicles

      VehicleRU[] getVehicles()
      Returns all vehicle risk units, if any, associated with the Policy.
      Returns:
      The vehicle risk units

    • getProperties

      LocationBasedRU[] getProperties()
      Returns all LocationBasedRUs, if any, associated with the Policy.
      Returns:
      The location-based risk units

    • getAddresses

      Address[] getAddresses()
      Returns an array of addresses associated with the Policy through both PolicyLocations and Contacts.
      Returns:
      The addresses

    • getAddressesAndSourceMap

      Pair<Address[],Map<Address,KeyableBean>> getAddressesAndSourceMap()
      Pair of suggested addresses and map of Address and KeyableBean from which address was found
      Returns:
      Pair of Address and Map of Address and KeyableBean

    • getPolicyAccount

      Account getPolicyAccount()
      Gets the Account corresponding to the
      invalid reference 
      account number
      Returns:
      The account to which this policy belongs

    • setPolicyAccount

      void setPolicyAccount(Account account)
      Sets the Account for this Policy.
      Parameters:
      account - The account for this policy

    • getRiskUnits

      List getRiskUnits(IEntityType subtype)
      Returns a list of all RiskUnits of the given subtype
      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • getAllowedContactRolesForEntity

      List<ContactRole> getAllowedContactRolesForEntity()
      Returns all allowed contact roles for a policy
      Specified by:
      getAllowedContactRolesForEntity in interface com.guidewire.cc.domain.claim.ClaimContactRoleOwner
      Returns:
      a list of allowed contact roles for a policy

    • setCurrency

      void setCurrency(Currency value)
      Sets the value of the Currency field.

    • addToCoverages

      void addToCoverages(PolicyCoverage value)
      Adds the given element to the Coverages array. This is achieved by setting the parent foreign key to this entity instance.
